Have a seat anywhere inside and you'll soon see why this place will become a staple.   Just be prepared for eyeing all the plates exiting their kitchen.  Smell that rosemary?!  Order a fried green tomato app and then peruse their quite extensive menu.  Wait, still not past the array of beverages.  Let me suggest the smores latte- it's a succulent dessert in itself!  Well, perhaps it will suffice for breakfast, or dessert or both;)  
The hash dishes here could very well be considered a 'creative journey' for eating:)

Absolutely awesome! Nice ambience, excellent customer service and the food is delicious. You need to try it. So if you visit Las Vegas or you are local you must have breakfast or brunch here! You will love it!

This is my first 3 star review.  I feel all dirty inside.  So, let  me toss the pro and cons right at ya!!!

I've dined at Hash House many time's.  Mostly because I have lot's of friends who come to town for short visits and don't wanna go to a casino. It does have a nice atmosphere. ( for being a converted Chevy's....yes, it's a converted Chevy's)  One of the most consistent things is the cocktail's. I love me the gin and tonic!!! WHOOO!!!  Especially Bombay Sapphire and Tonic.  Every time I order one at the Hash House, it's perfect. So, Pro 1 is that they have a great bartender.
Pro 2 it's got ATMOS.

Now for the crap fest.....at first appearance their giant plate with a branch of Rosemary ( I'm pretty sure it's Rosemary ) sticking right out of the top is AWESOME, however, for the most part a plate of bland potatoes.  Any restaurant that has a beautiful steak on the menu, then covers it in tasteless gravy and buries it in mushed potatoes....needs to go back to the drawing board.   I'm not sure where i read it, but a true test of an great restaurant is how they serve a steak.  Sad part is the beef was fantastic, cooked just the way i wanted it....but, covered in crap and under seasoned.  Booo!

In closing....they got personality.  And most people say a great breakfast menu too.  (GIANT PANCAKES, cute)  I've had breakfast there.....packed with people, had a salmon scramble....dry and way fishy, ick!  It was accompanied by a swell mimosa.....so they got the liquor part in spades.  Take a chance and feel their vibe, but when you choose what to eat, be really friggin picky!!!!

Huge portions and quality food. We ordered the meatloaf and chorizo scramble. The meatloaf was surprisingly good! Great flavor very moist and really what gives this place five stars is the portion size, price, and quality. Service was excellent too. Next time we may just share a plate!

My goodness, talk about big portion sizes! You just want to eat every last drop, but it's so hard when so much goodness is piled on your plate. We went for breakfast, so as we sat around our table, I looked around at our plates filled with pancakes bigger than our heads, massive waffles, mile-high chicken dish, sizzling veggie hash, and a beautifully large pile of biscuits and gravy, I thought we must be in heaven. 

We had a large group, children included, and we were seated fairly quickly. The service was friendly and the friendly server even split up our bill into four checks without any problem or complaint. The decor is great, there are photos of the celebrities who have visited the place, and the space is pretty large.

So come hungry, even share a meal, and I promise you will leave with a happy tummy.

Always a great meal at Hash House. Love everything I have tried on the menu from the salads to the salmon and of course the chicken and waffles. Service is nice and the portions as well as quality justify the price which is about $15-20 per entree. Food comes out quickly and is beautifully presented, a staple every time we come to Vegas!

Chicken was bomb.

The serving was a lot, so come prepared to eat. 

The atmosphere was pretty dope too. They got celebrity pictures and signatures on the wall. Pretty dope.

The service was good, not great (forgot to place an pancake order). Pancake happened to be the best thing we ordered--glad we had her keep it. 

I ordered three staples that "put them on the map":
Bloody Mary
Chicken Benedict 
Chicken and waffles (wife)

Bloody Mary was ok 3/5. Chicken Benedict was ok as well--chicken was dry as all hell, mashed potatoes were really good, but overall the plate was just decent.
My wife had the same issue with her chicken being dry. 

The worst part of this experience was getting the bill--WAY OVERPRICED!  Save a ton of money and just go to an Egg Works. Way better food and you'll save money. 

2/5 because the food and service were just ok. However, the price was insane for what you get (Hyperbole intended). 

Bali Hai Golf Course bar has the earths best Bloody Mary--FYI.

Hash Hash has since responded to my original post--very classy. Because this joint give's a sh*% about their client experience, I added a star. I agree with the responder in regards to splitting meals and their portions being large. With all that being said, the chicken was still dry

Get off the strip, and get into something great! 

Hash House A Go Go is a fun place with giant size breakfast plates big enough for sharing. 

Food is good with lots of fun combos to choose fr.

Great HUGE food - Awesome Bloody Mary - Good service.

Had the Sage Fried Chicken.  We had to laugh when it came to the table...  It was a huge stack of waffles (with bacon sticking out around the edges) & fried chicken with a long steak knife holding it all together.  It had to have been a least a foot tall. The hot maple caramel reduction was very tasty and worked surprisingly well with the crispy fried leaks.

Make sure to come hungry and plan to share!

Food looked great but a very sweaty dude brings out my meal dripping sweat on my table and tells me to enjoy my meal. No way!!!

Maybe they were busy but there was no excuse for this. 

Could not eat it. 

Hell I couldn't even drink the water after that.

The food is always delicious, creative and plentiful at Hash House a go-go. My fave is the Scramblers with eggs and other ingredients.  I'm not a big egg lover but I'll order the one with bacon, avocado and onion even for a late lunch.  With griddled mashed potatoes, of course. You can't go wrong with anything they serve - just be prepared to take a box of leftovers home for a second, maybe even a third meal. 

The atmosphere is fun and sort of down home Midwestern (where I'm originally from) but with a sleek, urban flair.

Oh gosh this place, you certainly won't go home hungry.  The food here is such comfort food. How can they go wrong when mixing fried chicken, bacon, mashed potatoes, biscuits, eggs, cheese, tomatoes, spinach, and a Chipotle gravy. That's all in one dish. They were busy, but we only had to wait less then 30min. If you come to visit I think everyone should try this place.

I like eggs over easy. Most places, if you order eggs over easy you get raw, runny eggs. So I always order eggs over medium. So when I order eggs over medium and still get raw, runny eggs, it's really disappointing. A massive biscuit that turns into a pile of crumbs when you try pick it up is pointless. And as a bonus, they put a small stainless steel cup of red liquid next to your hash browns... SURPRISE, it's jam not ketchup.

quintessential breakfast Americana in portions so large that you'll need to be rolled out of there and you'll be knocked into a food coma for a good hour or two...mmmmm....food coma :-)

had the blueberry pancake (even though there's only one in the order, it was enough for 4 people)  and meatloaf hash.  also had the smoked salmon hash before at the san diego location.  the hash is what you go for!  served in a skillet, meat and veggies tossed with potatoes (potatoes were perfectly seasoned crispy golden on the outside and soft starchy goodness on the inside), two eggs anyway you like (love the over medium), fruit, and a homemade biscuit, which you MUST eat with the homemade strawberry jam...drool...sorry, lemme wipe now

there were so many other interesting menu items, like the bloody mary with chicharones and of course fried chicken and waffles.  too bad there isn't one in LA...hint hint

the only draw back for me personally is one of its trademarks, the ginormous portions.  i'm more of a small bites with mucho variety type of girl rather than a portion size that could have me eating the same thing for three meals...but that's just me :-)

We shared the chicken and waffles on a sunday afternoon for 20. 

- Fast seating! eat for 2? sit in a couple mins :)
- chicken was crispy. tender. had glaze on it. to compare with BBQ chicken, best of the best quality, it tasted pretty similar. so for the 2 pieces at a high price.. ehh.. but in defense, you think of presentation and they got style! 
- comes with 4 waffles with bacon inside. bacon stays crispy. thick slice. only got one maple, service was too slow to ask for another. 
- I'm more about getting full (with good food) at a cheap price. If you like fancy plating and the novelty of being at such a popular restaurant, this place is for you. 
- beware of men's bathroom. with the big portions you get, one can imagine... -____-
Presentation is great. However the ribs were gross, tough, and nasty. I did try my wife's monster pancake, not bad. However for the price I expect great ribs, not this crap.
Been  there nice. Waiting time was big on sunday. and Service was very Slow. Other than that everything was good.

My family drove me here after a sleepless night right after EDC.  We got chicken and waffles, crispy pork tenderloin,  and a sage fried chicken benedict. I was not mentally there to remember all the details or take pictures of food that day but I've had other trips to this place before and after EDC.

The food portions are for giants or about 3 people.  It's supposed to be hangover food but I remember feeling sicker after I ate and took 2/3 of my plate to-go. The food is marginal but thanks to Man vs Food, this place is popular especially with tourists. It's supposed to be food inspired by the MidWest. I'm from the MidWest and we've had better stuff to eat there. The chicken and the tenderloin were so fried, you can hurt your mouth while eating.

I'd like to write descriptions of each dish but thinking about it make me feel woozy. However, they do have a good watermelon drink with alcohol.

This place was everything it's "hashed" out to be. Awesome awesome awesome. For a breakfast/brunch place. The plates of food are gigantic! You can easily split here. The waffle was my favorite with the blueberry pancake close behind. The chicken Benedict was tasty but I only had a couple bites. It could easily feed a small family. Our server was real and I enjoyed his company... Although he called me fat in a subtle way I still like the guy. Come here for the novelty and you will be satisfied with the taste. Man vs. food joint.

Hash House is probably the most overrated joint in town. It's similar to Claim Jumper in the fact they have HUGE portions. The food is hit or miss. I only enjoy this place for breakfast. I've never over thrilled with dinner options.  The chicken and waffles is the best breakfast item, but you fell like a fatty eating it. And you will spend the next two days finishing it. I had high hopes for this place, but it just feel flat. The hostesses were rude and impatient. Service has always been impeccable.

The few things I like are their drink options. Their mimosas are out of this world, the s'mores mocha is genius (how has no major coffee house thought of this concoction?), and in the Summer time a watermelon lemonade hits the spot.

I often wish they had a little walk-up window (ala Serendipity 3) and I could just order a beverage and get food elsewhere.

Note that the breakfast wait is long and you cannot be sat until your until your entire party is there.

Good food, HUGE portions. Got a blueberry pancake plate and a waffle plate for 3 adults and one child. More than enough food. Good tasting food, very friendly and attentive service. Will give it another shot when I go to Vegas again.

we were excited to go to hash hash a go go... watching it on man vs food as well as all the great reviews... 

when we got there it was not that crowded, which was good. we got seated and our server was really nice.

she told us the corned beef hash was wonderful so i ordered that.  my baby ordered a standard breakfast.

when our meal came out, it was such a HUGE portion.. it was really just way too much.  what a waste of food.. i know that's there niche, but this was a lil over the top.  

i heard great things about there biscuits and the peach jam and i tried it, first of all it's a lil gross that the peach jam just sits on the table instead of having a new one placed each time.  secondly the biscuit was like a rock, i took one bite and spit it out.

the hash sucked.  it was home made but really just a big pile of mess on a skillet.  i took 2 bites and i was over it.  

i will tell you the saving grace from a 1 star, is the server took the meal off of our check without us even asking... she must have knew i didn't like it. since it was basically untouched.

this is a way too hyped up restaurant.. after reading reviews i wish i tried the chicken and waffles, but i wouldn't go there again.

Portions that would make a fat kid blush. 

Great presentation, delicious dishes, and always a genuinely friendly wait staff. 

All conflict comes from unmet expectations, so EXPECT to wait for your yum-yums. Plan on putting your name in, grabbing a BLT Bloody Mary (Kelly will make this for you) and chatting with your friends for at least a half hour until you get your table. I've been seated outside, on the patio, and in the bar, and all is well. My Greggo would suggest the chicken and waffles, and upon each dare, has successfully devoured all (don't judge him.) I have loved the Tractor Driver Combo, the Benedicts, and the hash.....om nom nom.

Their kiwi watermelon lemonade was absolutely delicious and refreshing!!  A must have!!  They gave a lot of food (pancakes are huge). I just had a simple breakfast of a buttermilk pancake with eggs and bacon.   My friend tried their meatloaf skillet which he didn't care for at all.

Wow. This place was better than expected!!!

Since I consider myself more of a connoisseur of "weird" foods as well as ethnic cuisines, I am not often excited by American concept foods. I do like uniqueness and thus upon buying a gift certificate to this place wanted to give "Twisted Farm Food" a try....and I'm VERY glad I did!!!

First, I am a big atmosphere junkie and Hash House Delivered 5 stars in this category. I liked the contemporary, slightly country decor. I dined here around holiday time, so there was Xmas tree decorated and placed smack in the middle--which added more to the whimsical atmosphere and the modern touches to the place. I liked the huge, modern and slightly utility-like looking tables/chairs and silver metal touches. A++ for decor!

Our appetizers were also rather delicious. Polenta and sirloin dish was extremely appetizing and flavorful! I'm craving it right now! Salad, however, was a bit overpriced and was the only item that was not large in size. I felt that lettuce was a bit wilted and flavors were not as full as they should have been. Very average at best for the salad.

Of course we tried waffles and chicken for dinner!!! This dish was more fun then super delicious, however with the humongous portion sizes and many stalks of sage, I got to love this dish' homey flavors and how can you not like the "baked in bacon" in the huge waffle? 

Aroma around the place was delicious! Think bacon mixed with sage. Yum. (I liked how all dishes had a similar sage decoration, it was very weird, but in a good, unique way).

Service was superb! Probably the best I've ever had. Not hovering over the table and interrupting, but being sweet and always quick with refills, recommendations and plate service.

I will definitely be back to this place! I do suggest sharing meals, and even with the extra plate fee (often waived), you will leave filled and even have left overs!

The food here is amazing. But you have to prepare yourself as the portions are huge, I would suggest splitting an entree with someone so you can still try an appetiser also. This place does get busy so think about coming on a weekday. I would either go to this one or Henderson and stay away from the locations on the strip much easier to get in and out of.

I'd give this place a 3.5 if I could.  The pancake I had was huge, filled with blueberries, and was delicious.  I avoid sugar, so I just had fruit on the side that I could put on top, instead of syrup.  The real highlight of the food was the fresh-squeezed tangerine juice that I had.  Holy crapola, it was SO good!!  Our server was nice and attentive, and the place was clean overall.  Really enjoyed looking at all the celeb memorabilia all over the walls, as well.  I'm super healthy and a vegetarian, so honestly there's not much here for me, but I definitely consider this an ok place to come for breakfast.

really wanted to try this place after seeing it on Man vs Food.  came on a Saturday morning and of course had to wait about an hour.  Food was good and portions were incredibly large.  I ended up sharing my plate with my friend which they charge an additional $2.50 just for an extra plate.  pretty shady but they got extra money out of me so i guess it's a smart business move on their part.  customer service was pretty good.  overall i'd have to say that this place was pretty good but i wouldn't want to wait in line to eat here.  the food is above average and the portions are really big but it's relevant in terms of price because most dishes are about $15 or more.  if i eat breakfast at denny's or ihop i would expect to spend about $8 and you get a ton of food.  so spending over $15 you can only imagine how much food you get.

Do you want to go-go to Hash House a Go Go?
Yaaaaaaassssss Queeeeen!!!!!

I'm always up for this fine establishment, but I was not pleased by the service.
The great thing about this place is that I can get my chicken and waffle fix while not being disappointed by the flavor.
Presentation is consistent.

BUT, to my dismay, service was not.
I've been to multiple different locations and although there has been a wait, when we get seated out server is usually friendly and accommodating- not here.

The server took our order and pretty much didn't talk to us at all besides that.  Then, that thing happens that bugs me beyond- inconsistent service.  I'm not sure what her prejudice was, maybe because we're from Hawaii or maybe because we're lesbians, but there was a straight Caucasian couple next to us that the server talked up a storm to.  We couldn't even get her attention to order another round of drinks.

I LOVE Hash House A Go Go, but I'll probably never make my way back to this location.

Went here because I wanted to take my mom since I'd been to the one in San Diego and loved it. Got seated in about 20 minutes, which was pretty good considering how crowded they were and the fact that it was Black Friday. Our food came out pretty quickly and everything was good, though I will say that the location in San Diego was better. While the portions were really large for most places, they were much smaller than the SD location, though that's not a bad thing since there was no place to take leftovers for us and it feels a bit weird to eat a burger with a knife and fork because it's literally impossible to pick it up. Service was a bit slow, but not annoyingly so. I wouldn't be afraid to hit it up again the next time I'm in Vegas.

Hash house has never been known for the cheapest place to eat but then again, considering that almost everything could be shared it actually is a pretty good deal. Our problem is that we never want to share one thing. There are too many good choices.
We have been to hash house a dozen times at least over the last 6 or so years. It never disappoints. That isn't to say everything is perfect. Some menu items are definitely better than others. 
On our most recent trip out. We noticed the new menus. Most of the same stuff but there were some new additions. One of which was the crab cake Benedict which my wife got. We have always loved the tried and true fried chicken benedict, but I must say this one may be better. I love them both. But if you like crabcakes, give it a try. Very good.
I also got the French toast. See? We can't share one thing. While it was very good. It didn't have enough syrup. Not even close to enough. All they gave was what was already poured on the plate. I had to ask for more after half a piece. Also, I gotta say this is a perfect example of better things to get. The French Toast is good. But that's it, just good. If I had a sweet tooth that day I would recommend the brown sugar banana pancake over this. My sister in law got the pumpkin pancake, big disappointment. Could barely tell it was pumpkin. Mainly by the color, not the flavor. 
All in all, hash house is great. Always fun and huge portions of good food.

After a long night of drinking, the only thing i want the next day is a huge breakfast to ease my hangover. Well, i found the hash house. The Kiwi-Watermelon lemonade was very refreshing and delicious. All of our plates were huge and pretty freakin tasty. There is a wait to expect, especially on a sunday morning. Service was a tad slow, but nothing to complain about. Would definitely return here.
Pricey and food was decent. It didn't teally stand out. I prefer Eggworks.

alright, i had the waffles and fried chicken. the chicken sure does give albertsons a run for their money. it was JUST how i like my women. brown and crunchy on the outside, sodt and succulent on the inside. the waffles weren't too bad either. this isnt your standard eggo kinda waffle. this thing was a beast! 

next time im in town im definitely getting the beer with a side of bacon. the combination just sounds too good to not try once in your lifetime. all in all... 4 stars. woulda been 5 but the waitress i was trying to get change from to tip HER server was probably on her rag. oh well, you win some you lose some.

I wish I could give this a negative number. Everything about this place sucks. The tables are sticky and unwashed, the silverware is just thrown on the bare table without napkins, the wait staff are incredibly irritating and bothersome. You can't even sit in peace going over the menu! The "atmosphere" feels like something supposedly futuristic created in the 40s that nobody thought to update. I wish I could make further comments regarding the food, but I didn't stick around to find out. I saw a waiter come through the door and drop a piece of bread on the floor, he simply picked it up put it back on the plate and delivered it to a table. I immediately walked out and will NEVER return.

Absolutely amazing! After a great bachelor party weekend for my cousin's fiancé, I met up with a friend in town for brunch.  

Not really sure where we should head for some grub, my friend asked our hotel doorman (at the Palms Place) where HE suggested going.  *Note: ALWAYS use your doorman for their suggestions if you want to find something really good quickly.  His advice: Hash House A Go Go.  His tip though was to stay clear of the one on the strip; it would have taken far too long to get us seated.  So, we headed to the location off the strip at Sahara & Rainbow.  Wait time: 5 mins.  Sweet.

I've eaten at this location and a couple of others around Vegas.  
Last week stopped by for breakfast, had the Chorizo hash, was a little surprised that the food came out before the drinks, and I had to ask for some butter for the biscuit that came with the meal, but the food was very good, hot, and very good flavor

In general, good food, and good service, I'ld say it has been 2 out of 10 times a fault in the service - worst case they forgot to have a runner bring out the food, it sat and was cold when it came out (they cooked new food, had it out quick and took some of the items off the bill)

For the food side, one friend who got the burger with bacon and mashed potatoes on the burger was a very strange combo.  I had a Thanksgiving turkey meatloaf that missed the mark for me (way too sweet).  

Over all, it has been a good experience, and it's a place that I try to get to when I get to Vegas.  Just be careful on the weekends, it can get rather busy

huge portions...average food...

go for the fun atmosphere, big portions, and huge fun menu...but don't come looking for great food. chicken ok..waffles ok...pancake ok..burrito ok....nothing extraordinary

We came here with a large party and we didn't have to wait very long.  Of course we got the chicken and waffle. To say the least it was impressive to look at and just too pretty to eat.  For me the breast meat is not my favorite I wish they have it available in dark meat.  The waffles were yummy with lots of butter and syrup. 
The first time we came looking for this place we missed it and ended up at another breakfast joint because the wait was too long.  We had 3 families and we just need to eat. 
The service was good and the place was clean.  It is just kind of pricy.  It could get four stars of you like white meat. But definitely enough to share a meal.

This place is hilarious! Truck Driver breakfast= Budweiser in a can, served in a brown bag with a side of bacon. Ha! Holy snickers pancakes! This thing can feed 5 people. The food is so funny but so good. You can pretty much share everything but who would want to do that? Oh and the Bloody Marys are totally insane. Only go here if you are starving!

My ex fiance and I came here based off his best friends rave reviews.  I have learned that wait time in the morning here sucks!  I actually came here on a very cold, cloudy and rainy day....which Vegas rarely gets.  We wait for 48 min to get seated and believe me every min. sucked!  So we go to our table and the server was nice but I cant remember his name....I ordered OJ and it was fresh squeezed and lacked sugar.  I ordered their version of country fried steak and it was nothing to rave about.  I didnt dig their potatoes a whole lot nor did I go crazy over their eggs.  For the price, Id say skip this place and go to Dennys.

Glorified Sage Fried Chicken & Waffles ($15.95) is a must order item.
Who doesn't love fried chicken & waffles? This is one of their popular item on their menu and the portion is HUGE. Perfect to share with people. Definitely in love with  their smoked bacon waffles and fried leeks. The little bit of tiny bites of bacon inside of crispy waffle & fried leeks, and you eat it all together with fried chicken breast (crispy outside and juicy chicken meat inside). What more could you ask for a perfect brunch meal like this? The taste of savory fried chicken & waffle with sweet syrup pouring all over and every bite in my mouth is like heave. It's so delicious yet very filling. This is a highly recommenced item and it definitely hits the spot!

The Hash House a Go Go is in an interesting place, located near car dealerships and your typical businesses. I was expecting it to be somewhere on the strip, but luckily it was easy to find right off of Sahara. It's a stand alone building with it's own lot. As I was told, the restaurants specializes in breakfast, although you can order lunch or dinner food as well. Breakfast is served all day. Portions are gigantic! I mean, huge, so come hungry. Unfortunately, I didn't come starving. I ordered a some drink called Watermelon-Lemonade, I may have the name wrong, but if you mention it to your server, they'll know what your talking about. It was sooooo good. For my meal, I was plain Jane and ordered a flap jack. It's so big, it hangs over the plate. I literally ate half of the inside of the flap jack. For the service and overall food experience, I'd rate them 3 stars. I would definitely return again and probably order something completely different though. I wasn't too impressed with the flap jack.

Delicious! The unique breakfast items are outstanding and come in huge portions. All of the eggs Benedict are fantastic. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is that 1) the bartenders struggled to keep up with the orders of my group (basically a few bloody marys and a few mimosas) and 2) the location is a bit out of the way, about a $20 cab ride from the strip.

Wow...just wow is all I have to say. Make sure your appetite is prepared for this hearty goodness. There's tons of brunch options, from creatively made coffees to different kinds of eggs benny to flapjacks. And 1 pancake alone will feed a family of 4. You have been warned. They have a lunch menu as well but their breakfast is where it's at. Get there early on the weekends because this particular location gets packed. Funny and friendly waitstaff, freshly made hot coffee and speedy efficient service. I love that it's off the strip too and away from the hustle and bustle.

I reserve my 5 star reviews for the most revered establishments, at which i have never had a care, worry or problem. That said, if i could, i would give Hash House a solid 4.5. 

Like a lot of folks, i saw Hash House on Man V Food. I had the place logged in the back of my head so when i was at a conference in Vegas for a week and the boss says "where we eatin'?" i was ready with a home run.

Ive eaten once at the original off strip location and once at the new location inside the IP. For the original, we were seated quickly on a weeknight and service was prompt, but that's not wat you want to hear about, is it?

The food is fucking MASSIVE. That night we had 2 appetizers, the fried green tomatoes and something else that escapes me. Both were good but i was focused on getting what i had been waiting weeks to try; the sage fried chicken and waffles.

Alright, so, 2 MASSIVE fried chicken breasts stacked on top of 4 bacon waffles roughly the dimensions of 2 hotel room Gidions bibles cut in half and stacked, all held in place with a huge steak knife. The chicken was crisp and delicious with sage running throughout. The bacon in the waffles was amazing and was topped off with a maple reduction. By the time i was done forcing as much into my body as humanly possible, i still had a meal left over for the next day.

You would have thought we were in a photo studio with the ammout of flashes going off. Everyone in here takes pictures of the food, don't be shy, show everyone back home what theyre missing. HHAGG goes on your Vegas bucket list.

Zero Complaints!

Believe all the hype!

Delicious food. Gigantic portions. Definitely a place for sharing. 

The quality of their food and drinks alone make this place worth checking out. Everything is fresh and made on location. All of their juices and even their chorizo is made on location! And it shows in the quality of their food. 

Definitely cannot wait to go back.

Came here for a birthday breakfast after a recommendation from a friend.  I'm glad we came here.  We ordered the fried chicken eggs and the roasted chicken benedict.  The portions were huge!  We definitely could not finish in one sitting.  Our meals were delicious.  The chicken was not too dry and seasoned well (not too salty, which is a common downfall).  I really liked the fact that they had tangerine juice!  yum!  Because it was a birthday breakfast, I had to ask if they would give us a free dessert, which they didn't.  However, we were able to get a candle on the birthday girl's order.  That was nice.  The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was casual and perfect for families and larger parties.

Prepare to unzip your pants and possibly vomit (in a good way)!

Thank you Vegas foodies for rating this spot so high and posting so many foodgasm shots of their popular Fried Chicken & Waffles plate. You guys led us here. And surprisingly, this place was packed on a random weekday during the daytime. We sat at the bar since there was no wait for the seating there. 

I ordered myself a monstrous hot chocolate to start. I seriously probably took about 3 sips of that thing. I felt so bad wasting all that warm, chocolatey goodness in that huge mug.

For grub I ordered one of their farm benedicts, hoping it wouldn't come out as huge as the the fried chicken and waffles plate. Boy was I wrong! My benedict came with smoked bacon, fresh tomato, fresh spinach, this roasted red pepper cream and topped w/ two basted eggs. What makes these benedicts so special is that they serve it on a fresh split biscuit with griddled mashed potatoes. Talk about CARB overload! Since I don't have a binge-eating disorder anymore, I barely made a dent even into this plate. Boo!

The bf ordered an actual plate that didn't come out monstrous. I believe it was just a simple breakfast plate with eggs, meat and some potatoes. If he ordered a flapjack (which are the size of a Thanksgiving turkey serving tray) he would have been screwed for sure.

Even if you plan to swing into this restaurant hungover, I suggest sharing a plate with 1 or even 2 other people! Portions are more than plentiful.
I wanted to take my friend from overseas.  This is interesting place to introduce.  Portion?  Oh yes it was too big to enjoy it but it is fun to take a picture.  :)

Hmm. What can I say? 

I got the duck breast. It was decent. A little overcooked for duck breast but certainly edible and very flavorful. 

But what's with all the fixin's? Not only is there too much on the plate but there are too many items. Goat cheese, prosciutto, cashews, spiced yams, carrots, green beans, and more. But it doesn't all taste good together. They are all great edible items but they aren't really "ingredients" to a single cohesive dish. FAIL.

And to top it off, literally, there's an inedible twig of Rosemary and some sort of uncooked pasta noodles sticking up out of the mound of food. Waitwhat? Yeah. 

I feel as if somewhere, like at the original HH in San Diego, the food is prepped and cooked the way that it is supposed to be. But here in Vegas, in this chain, it's lost in translation. 

You're better off going to a restaurant on the strip. Or Chinatown.

Food portions are huge and tasteless. I've been twice and felt the same both times. And they really really love SAGE for some reason!!!!! Also not cheap to boot. A $40.00 breakfast    For two? Not including tip?! 
If you serve lots and lots of glop, it's still just glop. 
Go elsewhere and save your wallet and your waistline.
It was my first visit to the Hash House and the food tasted great! The watermelon kiwi lemonade was good! I don't recommend the pistachio mocha not very good ....
Soooooo good!!! Biscuits are like seriously my weakness! I wish this place was in LA right now!

I actually love Hash House, believe it or not.  But this last experience was pretty horrible.  I went there with my girlfriend and daughter.  All the entrees had problems but I will only review mine.

It took 10 minutes for a server to stop by the table.  When he finally showed up, I showed him the restaurants.com certificate I had and he took the orders. I don't know if the certificate had anything to do with it, but we didn't see him again until the food arrived 25 minutes later.  This was slightly alarming since I realized in the interim he never asked me how I wanted the meat in my entree done.  

Disinterested service aside, when the food arrived, it looked and smelled delicious.  I had the special, which was a mixed grill with duck breast, lamb chops and a boneless ribeye.  I soon realized however, why he didnt ask how I wanted it done.  The lamb chops were just medium, well prepared and tasted good.  However, the ribeye was only about a centimeter thick, and I'm thinking they could have cooked it for a minute on each side and it still would have turned out how I got it, which was well done, dry and flavorless.  Very disappointing for a cut of meat that is pretty easy to get right in my own experience.  

The duck had the skin left on which I was excited to see at first, until I realized they made no effort to crisp it at all.  It was so chewy I had to peel it off just to be able to eat the meat, which was now devoid of seasoning. 

The best thing about the entree was the mashed potatoes.

Very very disappointing experience considering what I've come to expect from Hash House, which is big, well prepared portions of delicious food.

What a great place. The food is top notch to say the least.  Saw this place on the tv in the hotel room and decided last minute to come here rather than going to the strip.

I got the pork sandwich and my wife got the pot pie.  Both of them were outstanding. Bruce service was as well. We got there at 9, right when they were closing and they still say us.  Most places would have turned us away but they welcomed us and told us to take our time.

Thanks again!

I've been here on 2 occasions. The first time I got the fried chicken benedict and it was not that great to me. I thought the smothering of the whole plate with the chipotle cream sauce ruined it for me. My second trip yielded much better results. I had the salmon scramble with brie cheese. It was delicious! Of course the portions are outrageous, but not a bad meal. Three people for breakfast was $76 with Mimosas of course.

I am surprised by all the accolades and 5 star ratings that this restaurant is getting. The Sushi chef is apparently from the strip from a top sushi restaurant (Social House?)... sounds impressive... yet I was not impressed. I was told that this can give Nobu a run for its money.... Fact: this restaurant's food does not come anywhere close to the quality and excellence of Nobu. 
The food was okay... the sushi was good, the sashimi was just ok and in fact, the yellowtail sashimi was very disappointing. I did not eat much as I did not find it all that appetizing, and I love sushi and sashimi. 
The ambiance is plain and boring, which would likely have been overlooked if the food was really good. 
It was not bad, yet it was not great. I will not be going back. There are WAY better sushi restaurants off the strip in Vegas.

I have been here in a while but every time I come I forget how HUGE the portions are and how delicious the food is great place to come and bring friends for a good home-cooked breakfast or even lunch as you can see from the video the food is beautiful the staff is courteous thanks again Teresa !

Food was alright to say the least. I expected a little more from what i've heard.
Came here for breakfast and ordered the Farm Scramblers that consisted of of Ham, Spinach and cheddar cheese. The flavor was pretty good but not enough to make up for the high price. The service was great though! Aside from the high price, Hash House A Go Go would be a nice place to have a bite to eat with friends.

Got the chicken bemedict. Delicious! Love the different flavor combos. Moist fried chicken, spinach, egg, tomato, cheese all smothered in chipotle cream. Sitting on top of a huge pile of waffles and biscuits. Didn't eat much of the mashed potatoes because I felt like that was the filler on the plate. This could definitely be shared between two people if you aren't that hungry. My dad got the fried chicken and waffles which looked delicious as well. I will be sure to come back and try the hash.

Man vs Food, Rachael Ray, Diners, Drive-ins and Dives approved? Yes, Hash House, you have my attention! 

HUGE portions. Chicks can easily split an order. 

"Twisted Farm Food" is exactly what this place serves. 
Biscuits and gravy: lots of sausage, gravy is smooth and thick. YAY FOR NO LUMPS! Oh yeah, that's served on mashed potatoes!

Hash House Original Benedict: No hollandaise sauce here! Instead topped with a roasted red pepper cream sauce. Yum. 

Waffles and French Toast: about 1.5" - 2" thick. Serious carb action going on here. 

Pancakes: Good luck finishing ONE. 

Hash skillets: The guys at my table finished theirs, so yeah, they were pleased. 

All fruit is purchased through different distributors only when ripe and in season. Yes, I asked. :-)

Servers have their shit together. They close at 2:30 and re-open for dinner around 5-6pm. 

It's worth the 15 min. trip off the strip.

BIG, FAT FOOD. 

I couldn't wait to try it. It was tough trying to decide on what to order for breakfast since I don't eat pancakes or pork, but I found a veggie breakfast hash. It was a delicious combination of artichoke hearts, spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, and mushrooms sitting on a mountain of country (fried) potatoes with a side of eggs and a biscuit. Damn that's alotta food! 

The best though, was their homemade strawberry jam. OMG, I would have stuck the container in my purse if I thought I could get away with it. Delicious!
Place is fun and good is good but not worth the insane wait that they allllways have here.

This place is outrageously delicious!  The portions are GIGANTIC, so sharing a plate might be a good idea. I had their signature Sage Chicken and Waffles (the Waffles are stuffed with smoked bacon).  It was sinfully delicious, as expected.  The prices aren't bad, considering the amount of food you are getting.  Ohhhh, and the coffee is AMAZING too!!  This is a definite "Must Do"!

The Sage Fried Chicken and Bacon Waffle is so good! I shared this with friends, way too much food for me to eat alone. But the chicken was perfect! The flavor was amazing. Then paired with the bacon waffle and maple syrup made the sweet and salty combination just sing in your mouth. One of my favorite dishes!
Best chicken and waffles! Had great service for Candice the host. She rocks! Made the wait worth the wait! Great food Best service!

GO FOR BREAKFAST. We went fairly early in the morning and decided to go to a less busy location. It seemed like the perfect time or the perfect location since we sat right down and our food came out very quickly. 

Before we ordered our waitress had warned us that the portions are HUGE and she was not exaggerating. Everything that came to our table was beyond gigantic. 

I split my order with my coworker and we ordered the Sage Chicken Eggs Benedict. I have never really had Eggs Benedict so I don't have much to compare it to. It came out on the most giant plate and even splitting it, we could not finish the whole thing. The bottom was their famous mashed potatoes which were to die for, layered on top was a row of biscuits, on top of that was a mix of fried chicken, bacon, tomatoes, and some greens, all ok top of that was scrambled eggs and their amazingly delicious holindase sauce. The sauce had a spicy kick to it making it the best sauce on a breakfast concoction I have ever had. The rest of the menu didn't seem too adventurous for me, but I am in no way a breakfast person, so I might not be the one to trust on this one. But what I had, I was very pleased with.

I went on Christmas eve and really didn't know what to expect since it was my first time. I have read the reviews on Yelp and I have to say they do give you a lot of food, but it is also a good meal as well. I had Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Bendict. It is a split biscuit on top on mashed potatoes. The biscuit is topped with spinach, tomatoes, scrambled eggs, fried chicken breast and topped with a chipotle dressing. 

This dish is massive and it looks like everything but the kitchen sink was thrown into this dish, but for all the ingredients that are combine here, it works. The flavors compliment each other very well. It was recommended by Adam Richman, who host Man vs Food on the Travel Channel. A very good recommendation. 

My wife asked if I would have the dish again and the answer is "hell yes!" I would like to try some of the other dishes on the menu. There is a wide range to choose from. Make sure to bring your appetite.
The food is ok they give you a lot of starch as a filler - huge portions
Fried chicken and waffles with fried leeks was amazing!!! If you want a boss breakfast that's super tasty and portions are awesome sized. My new favorite breakfast spot

If the food wasn't so good we would only give this place half a star. The service was horrible. 

This place is always high on our lists of places to hit up every time we head to Las Vegas. Usually there is a long wait, but that usually gets erased by the great service and food. Well... this location needs some major help. 

I ordered Andy's Sage Chicken, and my wife had French Toast. 

We arrived around 1200 so we expected a slight wait which would be normal. Well we ended up watching 2 groups of people, with the same number in their party as us, get seated before us. 

After we got seated we waited about 15 minutes for our server to come over. She seemed bothered by simple menu questions we had about the special items. Then wanted to rush us into ordering and we had yet to be asked what we would like to drink. We then asked for a Diet Pepsi and a Mountain Dew. Well she retuned with 2 Pepsis and we kindly asked for what we ordered and she seem disturbed by this. She brings us the drinks and then vanishes to other tables and stops servicing our table. We sit with empty glasses and no service. After a few minutes a different server tops off our drinks and then my food comes out 10 minutes before my wife's. So my food is getting cold. Finally my wife's French toast comes out (I guess that's a difficult dish to make). So nobody checks on us to see how we like the food. We got just 1 refill. The front of the house lady dropped off our bill and we payed and left.

Great place,  super fast service and humongus portions!!! I love it.
The cucumber dressing is very good and light. Love the service and its also great for kids.

Hash House A Go Go is located in the Imperial Palace Casino.  Above the casino is the restaurant.  I think this restaurant is what saves Imperial Palace to tell you the truth.  The casino looks like Circus Circus's Casino.  I heard they'll be doing renovations, but we'll see.  Anyways, onto the restaurant.  They don't serve your traditional comfort meals, it's more like comfort meals with a sprinkle of swank and steroids!  The meals are HUGE!  They even have a sharing fee of $2.50 if you don't get your own plate, who does that?! lol  I've only came here for brunch and it is good hangover food, but the service can get slow when too many people show up.  I like the food.  The place is just too hyped up because it's a good place to people watch and the portions of their food.  I've had the Andy's Sage Fried Chicken, the Bacon Waffles ( I would never get again because the bacon was soggy in the waffles!) Most of their entrees are DOUSED in a heavy sauce!  Music in the place can get too loud.  I don't like to come here, but majority rules when you're in LV with friends and they seem to like the place, QUE SERA SERA to me.

3.5 stars, but rounded up to 4. 

Mushroom artichoke hash  -- portions were very large, but this was just not very good, unfortunately.  The sundried tomatoes were too overpowering. 

The banana pancakes were ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. The edges were kind of crispy (probably because it had been soaked and fried in butter... mmm).

If you are visiting Vegas, I would recommend sharing a dish since you WILL have plenty of leftovers... and as much as I try to avoid wasting food, it's hard to eat leftovers when traveling (no fridge, no microwave, etc.). 

Our server was really great.  We had to wait 30 mins for a seat, but it was well worth it for the pancakes.

"Farm food with a twist"...that's right! 

It's like, wow. I am speechless cause I'm too busy stuffing my mouth with amazing goodness! My oh my, the food here is delicious and the servings are huge! I can see why the servings are big because when you work on the farm, you're gonna need a lot of energy to burn. However, when in Vegas, you'll need the food to feed that hangover! 

Came here on our last day in Vegas (and no, we were not hung over) to experience all the buzz everyone is talking about. Ladies and gentlemen, you were all right! We got here a few minutes right when it opened so we didn't wait long and were seated immediately. They don't take reservations, but it seems that on Sundays at 8am, there is no line! Anyway, the hostess was friendly and the place looked clean. Our server was friendly and gave great recommendations. She was honest about how much food there was and she also informed us about plate serving and local faves. Great customer service!

I got the HH Original Benedict and loved it! It's Eggs Benedict on top of mashed potatoes filled with bacon! It's a dream come true (fluffy potatoes with bacon)! And the red sauce was sweet with a touch of hot sauce. I only finished half of my meal and took the rest home. We shared a side of gravy and it is just as amazing! It was warm, creamy, and had sausage chunks! It complimented the bread & biscuits we ordered. I love the coffee here! Our server told us it comes from California but forgot to write it down. Oh well. 

I was stuffed by the end of the meal! I had to walk around for a bit to make sure digestion was happening and to ensure I make room for the second half later! Definitely a place to try farm food that is twisted!
Their food is SOOOO good! I have eaten there a few times, and I have always been impressed by the food and the presentation.

People aren't kidding when they talk about the portion sizes. 

Hash House A Go Go, you are just fascinating!

We came here on a Wednesday morning for breakfast. The wait wasn't too bad. It took about ten minutes for them to give us a table for two. 

We enter the restaurant. Hrm, it was a bit loud. My girlfriend and I could not take our eyes off the plates being served as we walked in. Patrons around us were gorging on gargantuan plates, while a few packed lots of leftovers into to-go boxes. We decided to share a plate.

We ordered Andy's Sage Fried Chicken. We got the option with a biscuit, two pieces of chicken, two eggs, two slices of bacon, and mashed potatoes. The food didn't take too long to come out. But it would have been worth the wait. The dish looked divine!

There was a huge rosemary stem sticking out of the mashed potatoes. The scent was deliciously fragrant. The chicken was seasoned very well. It was a bit sweet! My stomach is craving for more as I write this :[ ahh. The biscuit was good, and the mashed potatoes.. oh myy, there was just so much. Even though we shared the dish, we could not finish it. We were too full. Oi.

Be warned that it's no joke when people say that the plates are huge. Be mindful of your order and don't let your eyes deceive you. Your stomach will hate you for it when you're wolfing down the rest of your meal. 

Hash House is a win for me.

I can't understand why this place is so popular? Then again, everyone I know who goes here can't boil a three minute egg.  I've been to both locations and was not impressed at all.  The food was sub par and the service was terrible.  Unless your picking up the bill, I'm not stepping foot in the place.  Matter if fact, I wouldn't even offer to leave the tip.
Enormous portion sizes, and waffles are BOMB too!

2nd time here and I don't think we'll be back. Portion sizes are ridiculous and when you want to split something they charge you roughly $4 or you can order a side to compensate so I did. We got the breakfast quesadilla with a side of bacon. The quesadilla was very good but the bacon was so frickin' limp and soggy it wasn't even funny.

If this would've been taken care of in a decent time frame I wouldn't be giving them 2 stars but our waiter didn't check on us until the time for the frickin' check! We ate that huge quesadilla, sat around with no drink refills and then he finally brings the check which I told him to take the bacon off cause I wasn't paying for it.

Quesadilla - Good. Bacon - Horrible. Service - Sucked.

P.S. Turn down the volume on the stereo!

This place gets pretty crowded.  It's like a Denny's/IHop on crack.  Their portions are ridiculously huge.  The vanilla pancakes were just OK. I also had the corned beef hash with eggs. I'm glad I shared my food.  The staff was pretty friendly.  It gets really noisy but the food was good.  I will come again and try something different.

I want to say something nice about my experience here....it's nice that I didn't have to wait to be seated for a Sunday evening dinner. All right, enough of that. I thought this place was supposed to be good. The building, chairs, and staff seemed a little run down. It was sad.
The dinner menu is limited and doesn't have scrambles or omelets. I ordered the Meatloaf Pasta because it sounded interesting but I ended up getting the spaghetti and meatballs. I didn't know it was the wrong thing until my final bill confirmed it. It was spicy, had a bunch of sticks on top of it, and had no flavor. I don't know what my wife bought but it looked like a pile of random crap in a skillet.  
 My waitress put in less than the bare minimum effort. She seemed to be hiding the whole time and had some kinda hearing problem. She fluttered away as we brought up missing items and inaccuracies on the final bill without response. It's worse when you see the only other waiter in the room working his ass off and treating his customers well (you know, checking on everyone, getting their orders right, listening...that sort of thing). Chances are if he was my waiter I wouldn't have written this, I still would never go back there, but I wouldn't have written this review.....

This was the only highlight of my stay in the hotel. On our last day we wanted to go out with a heavy breakfast before the long drive back to Los Angeles. 

Our wait was about 35 minutes but totally worth it.  Food portions are GIGANTIC! In order to really enjoy your food, you need a appetite.  The slogan does not lie in terms of a twist on farm food. The inside as well is very well set up in terms of feeling like you are in a upscale diner with farm twist to it.  This may have been the best breakfast experiance I have ever had, especially for the right price.

My girlfriend for starters got a S'Mores mocha that looked like a Frankenstein creation of a drink. Marshmallow was melted on top with chocolate and graham cracker mixed in it. The drink was huge and we did not want to touch it since it looked too good to drink. We started to actually sip it with a spoon like soup because of the sheer size and an inch deep layer of marshmallow on top. I highly, highly recommend the drink.

In terms of what I ate, I got the french toast which came with 3 giant slices of french toast, scrambled eggs, half a fried banana and two big strawberries. I could not finish my meal because I was so full.  No exaggerations here on size of food. 

Whenever a server walked by with someones food, people at other tables would be staring at the mere size and display of the food. When I was walking out, I saw some giant sandwich or sorts with a even larger knife sticking in the  middle of it. The displays of food sets this place apart from any other breakfast joint.

I can't wait to come back here.

One of my favorite places to eat breakfast in the LV area.  I got the Tractor Driver Combo with French Toast.  It was very very good.  My Fiance got the Mushroom and Artichoke hash which was ok, I like meat in my hash and this was meatless.  Waitress was very attentive and friendly, coffee cup never empty and normal wait time for food.  Cant ask for much more.  Would give it a 4.5/5 but that is not an option!
LONG LONG wait times. Never got the opportunity to try the food cause the wait was longer than they said

My husband and I wanted to go here after we saw Man vs Food do their Las Vegas episode here. So we were planning a trip to the Hoover Dam and Grand Canyon and decide to stop here for a big breakfast. Make sure you split with someone because the portions are unbelieveable huge. They charge a split plate fee. We got around that by ordering an extra biscuit. Anyway we ordered The Tracker Driver combo. We got scrambled eggs, bacon, and the HH signature snicker flapjack. WoW!!! Pure heaven on a plate. I will add that service did suck here so if you are in hurry this place doesn't work for you!! We ended up eating at the bar area since it was a line for the resteraunt area.

We've driven by this restaurant all the time, even had a Travelzoo we bought a year and a half ago and forgot we had it when we moved here. It is a "comfort food" restaurant, which means lots of food, big ass burgers, fried this and that. I'm not being critical, but it is what is and it was pretty darn good. It's good for families, kids and there were plenty of them, surprisingly all were behaved. We ordered polenta sticks, sounded interesting, fried green tomatoes and their world famous Andy's sage fried chicken. Needless to say we didn't finish it all and looked at each other and said next. The service was great, prompt and by a helpful young man named Oscar. I would say for us, we aren't this kind of comfort food folk, but for those who are....have at it!

Every time we come to Vegas first place for breakfast is here.  We had Victor as our waiter this time around and he was phenomenal. Chicken and waffles were awesome and can feed 2 people easily. The burgers are tall and cooked perfectly. We will be back

Slow... That is the take away I got from this visit. Having visited this location before I can safely say they have fallen down a notch or two. The first time I visited I was wowed by the speed and the awesome service! THIS visit was different than the first. We waited a short minute or 3 to be seated as there was no host present. While waiting patiently I started to wonder if we would get service... When server approach he asked for the Drink order. I ordered a Miller lite and after ordering drinks I went to restroom and came back to table and started a timer... having sensed that this could be a lengthy visit...not intentional but good grief here we go!!! Our server - he may have had tooooo many tables to serve. In my opinion/perspective some people can handle 4-5 table sections....others can't. Maybe it was scheduling or something...but I tooknote of at least 5 tables he was trying to service and 3 of the 5 had 5 or more at the tables. So I now know THAT my table is on the back burner... It took 12 minutes from time of order to inquire about the Miller Lite. He said it would be dropped off by bar staff. I said just cancel it. I was now dissatisfied... After finally getting the server to stop by again the order was placed. Everything was delivered by some person not our server...after food arrived our server waited until we were done to check on us and bring ticket. I guess that's how it goes. Potatoes on the plate were cold but by this time I was over the visit and didn't let the server know as I could only imagine how long a fresh order would have taken. The price was higher than most brunch places and I guess I just expected better than that. My first time certainly set the bar...I know we will not visit this location vs others that were closer to our casino hotel. 
As far as taste of the food...the bacon waffle was a hit!
The Basic was good minus the cold potatoes.

Rating is 2 star due to the bacon waffle!
Respectfully,
Bryan

This place was really really good!! They aren't kidding you about the portion and that's what I liked best about it. The price is reasonable and the food itself was pretty delicious. I ordered the Sage Fried Chicken Penne and though it needed more seasonings, it was HUGE!!!! Our waitress was also very nice and she checked up on us regularly. I will be coming back to Has House A Go Go when I come back to Vegas!!!

so, after a late night of over drinking we needed something to help us after we woke up drunker than skunks still! i googled best breakfast in las vegas and this popped up! thankfully google did not let us down!

the wait was non-existent luckily because we chose to sit in the bar. the place is loud but it's worth it for the food you get

the quality is amazing. the portions are enormous. i'd consider the pricing fair considering how much they put into the food. 

my bf and i shared the chicken rosemary hash with a side of bacon. my friend got a vanilla waffle. thank god we shared because that was insane. it was bursting with flavors and the best part was definitely those crispy potatoes. yum overload. the biscuit was flaky and with the homemade peach jam was heavenly. but by the end of that meal i was bursting too. i tried some of my friends waffle and it was delicious. the thing was the size of her huge plate and somehow they got the whole thing to be fluffy in consistency.

it's kind of out of the way but well worth the drive. theres also one located at the M before you head into the heart of vegas.

This place is ok and an average chain restaurant nothing amazing. The only time I eat here is to take out of towners somewhere new and kinda well known. Everything is overpriced and taste is ok. Chicken and waffles not the best. The waffles are soggy and not fresh and crispy like it should be. The kiwi watermelon drink is great though, very resfreshing.

Went here after finding out the location at the Rio was not open for dinner.  Huh?

Anyway, I've seen this place featured on those food shows, so I knew I wanted to try it out now that they're in Vegas.  It was around 7:30pm on a Thursday night when we got here.  Not very crowded at all, which was fine.

I knew I wanted to get the MVF featured Sage Fried Chicken Benedict.  It didn't disappoint.  It is GINORMOUS!  It is also delicious.  I was afraid the fried chicken breast would be dry, but it is moist and flavorful.  The flavors work well with the rest of the giant mound of food on the plate.  

Get this and you won't be disappointed.  You'll have leftovers too.
I enjoyed their bacon Bloody Mary!  The portions here are outrageous! I recommend doing any of the hashes!

So.....I want to love this place. I REALLY want to love this place but dag nabbit, I do not. I realize I only went twice but this most recent time was just ughhh....

Chicken pot pie. Sounds easy and simple and reliable and bae AF when your stomach is a hot mess and you need sustenance. WRONG. I know what a chicken pot pie looks like. YOU know what a chicken pot pie looks like. A chicken pot pie is indeed NOT what was plated in front of me. It was more like a chicken chowder with a sombrero looking bowl/chip and mashed potatoes hiding beneath. 

What the what?!??

Why?

The disrespect. 

On top of that, it had the audacity to be bland!! Like NO flavor. I don't like salt, I don't cook with salt but dammit I added salt. Pepper. And some hot sauce but couldn't make it good .

If I shoot out to Vegas again, I may give it one last try but this last visit did absolutely nothing for me. 


.....I sad.

I had forgotten how huge the portions are here so prepare to knock out as soon as you get home. I recommend sharing a plate if you don't plan to take some home! 

My boyfriend and I came here around lunch time over the weekend and it wasn't packed but it wasn't empty either. The place is pretty dark with only a few Windows to let natural light in. Otherwise everything is pretty yellow due to the light bulbs. There's also a choice between a booth or a table. 

Our server was Kyle and he did a great job! He introduced himself and immediately greeted us in a friendly manner, got our drink orders and made some recommendations as to what's popular. I went for the chicken and waffles, my boyfriend got the pork tenderloin and we shared a gigantic red velvet pancake. As soon as I saw all the food, I realized I wasn't as hungry as I thought I was. 

I ate as much as I could and took about half of it home. The way they plate and decorate their food is unique, the knife stabbed into it is a real eye catcher. 

This isn't a place I would go back to too often because of how heavy the food can be, but I would definitely recommend it if you haven't been here before!

"Beast Warrior Proportions".

That's the best way to describe the amount of food that you get at Hash House.  A comparable visual would be that scene in the "Flintstones" intro where Fred orders the bronto ribs, gets said food, and the car tips over.  That's the experience here.  For that reason, I'm convinced they have steel reinforced tables.

Yesterday was the five year anniversary of this branch.  5 cent beers and free appetizers for their happy hour.  Not thinking, I failed to carry cash with me, and upon realizing this, there was no way I could have purchased a dollar's worth of beer via credit card.  My liver would have exploded.

So in going back to my car, I managed to scrounge about 30 cents out, which either makes me resourceful or a desperate drinker.  Between the five cent beers and tasty appetizers (their fried green tomatoes are wonderful), I was "good" for the my visit.

Normal, non-anniversary dining has always been excellent.  The food is good, the portions are stupidly huge, and the atmosphere is fun.  This is more than a "you get what you pay for" sort of place.  Their burgers are the size of small throw pillows, and their breakfast fare is tasty (and again, stupidly huge).

Get here early, as the place fills up fast, and they're only open for a few hours at a pop.  Who knows what will happen in "Year 10", but I imaging I'll have five years of various dining experiences throughout to figure out what they'll do by then.

I made the mistake of ordering my food without looking at other peoples' plates. I didn't notice the cyclopean heaps of steaming food on every table - I guess I was too wrapped up in conversation or something. But I doubt that as I rarely have much to say.

I decided on the mashed potato and bacon stuffed hamburger while my girlfriend went with the salmon and a large glass of tangerine juice - a particular favorite of hers and hard to find on many menus. Then a neighboring table received their order - pork chops. Looking past the gargantuan pile featured on the plate I saw that one side dish was an entire ear of corn. I began to panic.

Considering the amount of food served up, our orders came quickly and cheerfully from our server. Regret over my choice immediately consumed me and yet, I was excited by the prospect of attempting to consume approximately fourteen pounds of food in one sitting. The stack of my hamburger stood seven inches off the table's surface. I concluded right away that the fluffy bun on top could not be more than decoration, not intended to be consumed, like a garnish, and so it was discarded.

The menu stated crispy fries came with the burger. I was expecting thin, hard sticks of fried potato, but these fries were among the best I've ever had. Light and crispy on the outside, perfectly chewy on the inside with just enough grease to qualify as a french fry. It's too bad I couldn't finish them since the rest of the meal consisted of a two quarter-acre hamburger patties sandwiching a full liter of mashed potatoes.

It was easily the biggest hamburger I've ever seen that wasn't on TV trying to break a record. Knowing all too well that no human any smaller than Andre the Giant could pick this monstrosity up and take a bite out of it with their mere mortal mouth, Hash House supplied a huge steak knife stuck through the top of the so-called "sandwich." I am more likely to call it what it is - a gastrointestinal assassin, a destroyer of mens' spirits. The taste of the thing should not be in question. I will leave flowery descriptions of its taste and color and texture and the subtle hints of.... whatever to the real foodie types of Yelp. I am here to relate the experience, that is all.

About 1/3 of the way into my behemoth of beef and bacon and mashed potatoes, the waitress asked how we were doing. Words escaped me at first, so I nodded too enthusiastically, trusting her not to think I was choking. Perhaps I was chewing. Maybe I was catching my breath mid-forkful. But then I had to ask, "Are these supposed to be shared between two people? Have I misunderstood the whole CONCEPT of the restaurant?" She assured me no, these are meant for individual consumption. It's sort of like Man vs. Food with every item on the menu. I threw my napkin down in defeat. My white flag draped across the seat.

Somehow I kept eating for a long time, as did my date. We both managed to finish about 2/3 of our plates. I'm no competitive eater, but I feel that I can put food away. More than one person has told me I eat like I'm in the Army. Don't think, just keep shoveling it in. But the food won. During my stay at the Hash House, I didn't see anyone clean their plate. The pork chop lady needed more than one box to bring her leftovers home. I would have taken mine back if only my hotel room included a microwave oven in the same drawer as the Gideon Bible.

I left the restaurant broken and slightly limping, but happy, sated. I didn't need breakfast the next day. Though I would have liked to see what kind of flapjacks this joint would turn out.

Whew what a surprise. I'm in Vegas for a work trip and craving some breakfast at around 1pm and my friend suggests this place. We head on over wouldn't you know it, a stocked bar, friendly staff, and some BUMPN house music full up with a DJ. 
(record stopping screech) say what?

Yep a DJ. I asked and every second Saturday they have a theme complete with accompanied music. This weeks happened to be the theme of the EDM festival next weekend. 

So we sat down and ordered but not before I grabbed a BLT bloody mary in the souvenir glass that is in fact tilted. Crazy. I ordered the French Toast which could, EASILY, feed two hungry people. Holy portion sizes batman!!  And the food tasted very good! Fast and friendly service. This place is an A+

Go Go your ass to the Hash House A Go Go !!!

for sure one of the best places i have been too for breakfast! Huge portions (i asked for a side of artichokes and they brought me a whole damn plate :) ) and i love the creativity in the food display and the huge variety in the menu/drinks as well. Everything was great ..chicken and bacon waffles, vanilla waffles, crispy potatoes etc....yummmmm

A def must stop when you are in Vegas baby!

Ambiance: stylish and spacious American restaurant 

Service: fast and attentive, very friendly 

Food & Drink: general good, HUGE portions
  House smoked salmon Benedict - *** beautiful display, average taste
  Tractor driver combo - *** average taste
  Sage fried chicken and waffles - **** signature dish, fried chicken crispy outside soft inside, social waffle stuffed with bacon, delicious, recommend
  Famous twisted stuffed burger - **** #1. mushroom and Swiss cheese tasted better, #5. Bacon, avocado and Cheddar looked better 
  S'more mocha - *** over sweet  

Price: decent with food portions, overpriced for drinks

My sister told us about this place, and we were curious so we made the trek and we were NOT disappointed!

It was pretty busy, so they sat us at the bar.  I'd have rather sat in the main dining room so we can see exactly what we were in for.  We asked the bartender what they were famous for, and she pointed out the Fried Chicken Benedict.  My wife got that, and I got the Tractor Driver Combo with French Toast.

Our food came out on plates as big as my upper torso!  The Benedict was like a mountain!  It had a knife stuck in it and you couldn't even see the blade!  As far as flavor and texture, it was a little overwhelming.  Salty, sweet, spicy, oooey, gooey, thick and dry... you name it, it was on there!

The French Toast was good.  I would have appreciated a little syrup on the side.

I finished my french toast and I look over at Maple's dish and she didn't even put a dent in it!  We ended up taking it to go and eating it for lunch on the way home!

Skip the breakfast buffets and come here!

100% nailed their concept and food. Twisted farm food? Hell yes. Very good food, freshly made, amazing presentation, excellent twists on traditional comfort food with portions that could feed two people.

One platter can fill the needs of two hungry people. Three not so hungry people. A group of 5 for a snack. 

Get liquor in your coffee starting at 7:30 am. I would suggest the Mexican coffee. 

Loved the house smoked salmon w/ basil pesto, fresh tomato and melted brie cheese. Must get the french toast.
the chicken and waffles weren't bad but i'm not sure i want to wait 45 minutes to be seated again.

My friends chicken was brought to him raw!!  He couldn't even eat anything else because he lost his appetite after that. Couple other people in our group felt the same way because we were about to try it when we realized it.

Other than that the food was generally ok, nothing great. Big portions!!

Will not be returning.

Man....I love this place! Large portions and the prices are cheap! I got thr chicken and waffles! Biggest chicken n waffles ever! It was awesome! I tried finishing it, I was close though haha. The fried leaks were awesome and the bacon infused waffles....what the Fuuuuuuuuu no way I died....lol it was bomb
I was not thrilled with the food!   The presentation was awesome and service awesome but food kinda boring ... I'll try it again though when in in that area of Vegas...

OMG!  This place is off the charts!  Discovered it off of Yelp, just trying to find a good place off the strip to get the feel for a local experience.

Went here for Sunday brunch, it was crowded but got in after a short wait, maybe 15 minutes or so.

Got the Hash House Quesadilla stuffed w/potatoes, jalapenos, eggs & tomato w/chili cream with a side of mashed potatoes.  Service was efficient, friendly, warm and simply amazing.

When the food arrived at the table, wow!  Really big portions, got a sprig of rosemary.  Just a wonderful presentation.  The aroma was awesome!  I've been overwhelmed before with presentation (oh, it looks too wonderful to eat!) but never the presentation and the aroma!  I mean, it was so fresh, so vivid, the jalapeños were bright green, the potatoes so wonderfully mixed, the egg just done to perfection, the chili cream just right....mmmmmm....gotta tell ya I had my first foodgasm ever eating this very breakfast brunch at this very Hash House A Go Go.

My wife, who hates melon and citrus, couldn't believe how wonderful the melon slice was that came with our breakfasts.  Ate the whole thing.  The orange slice too!

Got so addicted we went back every other day while on vacation, trying other places then going back to Hash House A Go Go for some real food.

The freshness, the variety, the aroma, the taste, it was fantastic.

Gotta warn you, though, after coming back from vacation we've been dining out from time to time here, and it's just awful.  Even places we liked back home don't compare.  Too salty, no flavor, no aroma, not fresh enough, etc. etc.  We keep yearning for Hash House, I guess our next vacation will be planned near one of their restaurants.

It's like buying clothes all your life at Target and then discovering Armani Express or AG.  Except Armani Express and AG for the same price as Target.  You gotta wonder, WTF.

In summary: quantity over quality.  Perhaps it was the dish I ordered...the Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict.  By the time the dish arrived at our table, the chicken skin was drenched in the chipotle cream sauce to the point where the skin was now chewy without any crunch factor.  The chipotle cream sauce used for the benedict seemed under seasoned.  Fresh spinach and tomatoes were used....so I'll give them a star for that.  We also had to wait well over an hour for seats....all this combined made for a lack luster eating experience.  On a positive note, the snicker's pancake that we ordered was fluffy and well honestly anything with peanuts and chocolate is a win...and the pancake is about the size of a small pizza.  But overall, I'd rather go to Babystacks Cafe any day for a good breakfast over this place....

My cousin suggested this restaurant while we were visiting Vegas and I fell in love immediately with the place! Probably the biggest food I've ever seen in life! All the dishes are huge and plated beautifully! The restaurant is so unique and so lively! Great customer service, great food, and great drinks! I look forward to going here every trip to Vegas!  

I ordered the chicken and waffles! DELICIOUS !!

We never fail to visit this location whenever we make a trip to Vegas. We love the food, portion and the vibe of the place. My husband always orders the sage fried chicken & waffle and my usual is the chorizo hash. They're both so delicious but we're never able to finish the plate even on an empty stomach cause the portions are so big. I've also had their salad (I think it was cobb? don't remember), pancakes, and the corn beef hash and they're all equally yummy. 

The service was usually good during all of our past visits but on our last, the front staff never put our name down and we ended up waiting much longer than we needed to. We were all hungry and you're not you when you're hungry so when I found out, I was a little upset and for some reason, the service was a bit slow during our whole stay. But to make up for the mistake with the front staff, who turned out to be the manager, gave us free red velvet pancake so we couldn't stay mad. 

Couple friends and I are making our way back to vegas for the 4th july weekend and we'll be visiting again to try some new food on their menu.

MEH, i've definitely experienced better

i don't care how many good reviews this place got on yelp, after trying this place for myself, i can't help but give this place low ratings

we came here relatively early on a saturday, and there was no wait time, so my experience here was off to a good start

it seemed like the item to order on the menu was the chicken and waffles, so that was what i ordered

sure, the plate looked big, and the portions looked big, but when you really think about it, the food here is NOT worth the price

$16 for two pieces of fried chicken, and three bacon-stuffed waffles, REALLY?!?!?!  for a restaurant like hash-house, they have absolutely no reason to be charging such an exorbitant amount for such pedestrian food, i'm not paying for ambiance, there is none, i'm not paying for service, service was mediocre, i'm just paying for food

now, onto the food itself... yes, the fried chicken was good, the meat was juicy, the breading wasn't too greasy, and maple was a nice touch... the waffles on the other hand, was a completely different story, it's an interesting concept to cook the waffles with bacon inside, but the waffles were bland, and the bacon was nothing to rave about

i finished the chicken, but i couldn't get myself to finish the waffles, it just wasn't good, instead i just tore the waffles apart so i could get to the bacon, bacon is bacon after all, hehe

the best part of my meal was the apple juice, unlike most places, hash house actually has freshly squeezed apple juice, it's the apple juice you make at home, not the concentrated cr*p, so kudos to hash house for their apple juice

but yea... this restaurant was highly disappointed

my rating... 2.5

This was the second time that my wife and i had eaten there. The word AMAZING sums it up. We arrived right when the doors opened for dinner and where seated right away. The food was amazing and not horribly priced, especially when you look at the fact that you basically get 2 meals out of one meal. Really good food and great wait staff. One of our favorites and it is worth the trek off the strip if you are a visitor
